0.text: Bug 14807  Doing backward find/replace all causes infinite loop.

1.text: Build 20020412  In an editor window, type the following:  a.b  Put the cursor at the end of the text.

2.text: Select Edit->Find/Replace set the following dialog settings: Backward find: a. replace with: test.a.

3.text: Click Replace All  The editor will replace the "a.

4.text: ", but the insertion point will stay at the end  of the newly inserted text.

5.text: It will then see "test.a.b" and do another replace,  giving "test.test.a.b", etc.

6.text: The replace gets stuck in an infinite loop.

7.text: The only way to stop the process is to terminate the Eclipse process.

8.text: When doing a backward search/replace, the insert caret should be placed before  the newly replaced text to avoid this.
